The Centifolia rose is called the rose of painters because it is often depicted in the paintings of Flemish artists. Developed in the Netherlands, its petals are bright pink, with bristly and green leaves and many thin thorns.

The tea rose is called such because it is characterized by an intense aroma that recalls fresh tea. Originally from China, she traveled on ships used to transport tea to Europe. Characterized by bright yellow petals, it can reach a height of 2 meters. It produces fruits that are called achenes slightly covered by down. It can withstand both high and low temperatures but needs a lot of light to live.

The Mister Lincoln rose blooms during the months in the summer and autumn months with a unique flowering. It has a scarlet red tone and is velvety to the touch. It is a double flower with 15 to 30 petals and an intense aroma. It can survive between -10 ° C and 37 ° C and is therefore suitable for habitats such as Northern Italy and the Apennines.

This very ancient rose is a mutation of R. gallica officinalis. It is probably the oldest of the variegated roses. The flowers are light red and white, streaked in different ways. This plant does not develop particularly, it has a slightly erect and compact habit that changes, arching, when the flowering is at its maximum growth and is covered with light green leaves that fade to gray. It is not very thorny but the branches, twigs and peduncles are covered by a dense weave of bristles. The most romantic of the many legends about it says that it takes its name from "Fair Rosamund", the lover of Henry II.
